abstract: While the cost of providing Internet service keeps falling, cable companies are paying ever-higher bills for television services, especially related to sports. A day of reckoning is looming.
snippet: While the cost of providing Internet service keeps falling, cable companies are paying ever-higher bills for television services, especially related to sports. A day of reckoning is looming.
lead_paragraph: I’ve been looking closely at the recently announced first-quarter financial results of Comcast and Time Warner, the country’s two largest cable systems.

headline.main: The Problem With Cable Is Television
